activities.name: Girls Who Code Club
activities.description: Founded school's first Girls Who Code chapter, growing membership from 5 to 40 students
activities.impact: Increased female participation in computer science courses by 200%

activities.name: Regional Science Fair
activities.description: Developed AI-powered app for detecting early signs of depression in social media posts
activities.impact: Won 1st place regionally, 3rd place at state level

activities.name: Local Food Bank
activities.description: Organized weekly volunteer shifts and developed digital inventory system
activities.impact: Improved efficiency by 40% and served 500+ additional families monthly

core_values.description: Believe technology should be accessible and used to uplift underrepresented communities
Committed to giving back and making tangible impact in local community
Passionate about creating solutions to real-world problems

defining_moments.title: Starting Girls Who Code in a Skeptical Environment
defining_moments.description: When I proposed starting a Girls Who Code chapter, several teachers and students questioned whether there was actually interest. I persisted, starting with just 5 members and growing to 40 through grassroots outreach and creating an inclusive environment.
defining_moments.emotional_impact: Initially discouraged by skepticism, but felt validated and empowered when the club flourished
defining_moments.lessons_learned: Sometimes you have to create the change you want to see, even when others doubt its necessity

defining_moments.title: Building an AI App for Mental Health Detection
defining_moments.description: After my cousin struggled with depression, I developed an AI tool that analyzes social media posts for early warning signs. The project taught me that technology isn't just about coding—it's about understanding human needs and creating meaningful solutions.
defining_moments.emotional_impact: Felt helpless watching my cousin struggle, then empowered when I realized I could help
defining_moments.lessons_learned: The most meaningful technology solutions come from personal experiences and genuine desire to help others

defining_moments.title: Transforming the Food Bank's Operations
defining_moments.description: When I saw the food bank struggling with paper-based inventory that led to waste and shortages, I developed a digital system. However, training older volunteers required patience and empathy—I learned that innovation must be accessible to succeed.
defining_moments.emotional_impact: Frustrated by inefficiency, then proud when the system helped serve more families
defining_moments.lessons_learned: True innovation isn't just about the technology—it's about ensuring everyone can benefit from it
